title: DJ Sona: Answering some frequently asked questions.

embed.description: Voice for the new Ultimate Skin DJ Sona

body:
EDIT:
~~DJ sona is currently 50% off in the store in PBE. 1900 rp.~~  They have also decided... That they have no idea if this will go on sale or not. Also unknown until release.

~~She will be released some time within the next patch.~~ They changed their minds, it'll be out in a few months and anywhere in between. the date will stay unknown, but until then it will be out on PBE early. I can see why. There's definitely a lot of bugs that would come with something as big and complicated as this skin.

There can only be 1 Sona on 1 team, so if you were to play blind picks, there's a chance the enemy team will have a Sona as well with the same skin. Therefore the songs will overlap, and this is why the song is not global to both teams and limited to only yours. This will also confirm that this is as unique as you can get for a skin, so she will be the only one in game to have music tracks of their own. If anybody else DOES end up getting a musical skin concept, they will not come with their own music unless it involves an ability.

Song can be muted manually by YOU, and only be changed by the person with the skin, so be sure to make a majority vote on what you'd like to listen to. If you don't get what you like, well.. Too bad. It's their skin.

Tracks/skin can be changed by using the command /Toggle and choose or CTRL +5

VO: When you listen to her voice, it has been remixed and been made to fit her track accordingly. The fact you can barely understand her is ON PURPOSE..! Check the vid above.

Hope this helps some people. If you have any more questions, post them down below and i may gladly look 'em up to answer it.

 
I said "FEW" Months on purpose. Make sure people don't keep making the same mistake to buy rp and shit so early. The early hype is sly and quick. You'd want it so bad the sec it was heard you'd wouldn't think logically about saving your rp if you got it way too damn early and had to wait a least a full month till release.

replies.body: Hey just to clarify DJ Sona will not be out in patch 5.3. She's going to be on PBE for an extended period of time in order for her to get the proper amount of quality testing! She's very very complicated.  @u@

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Galetta,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=a7ExrdB9,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-02-05T00:57:31.153+0000)
>
> Hey just to clarify DJ Sona will not be out in patch 5.3. She's going to be on PBE for an extended period of time in order for her to get the proper amount of quality testing! She's very very complicated.  @u@

There are many of us that have problems with her voice over, or lack of one, not being consistent with the rest of her extremely high quality.  Does Riot have any intentions to address our concerns or will we instead be left to argue amongst ourselves?
They already have answered that question. They didn't want her voice to detract from the music, so it's designed to sound very distorted.

> They didn't want her voice to detract from the music

If that were truly the case then the only logical course of action would be to remove the voice completely. There is **no way** to have any kind of voice that wont detract from, or interrupt, the music. Additionally, the fact that the voice isn't actual words leaves the player wondering to themselves "the fuck is she even saying" every time she talks, further disrupting the natural flow of the skin. People *understand* what Riot was trying to do with the voice, It just doesn't work in its current state and it needs to be removed, or re-thought.

Right now, it seems like the whole "don't want her voice to detract from the music" reason just seems like a massive cop-out for making a voice that isn't up to par with the rest of the skin, and it's such a shame too. This skin is fucking godlike in every sense of the word but the voice drags it down so hard right now.

Once you play it, you'll know. Right now I'm testing it on the PBE and, honestly, it fits thematically. Even the mock-up mash video doesn't do it full justice. There is a video on SkinSpotlights that include the background tracks and the VO going at the same time, and the bug fixes today helped everyone have that experience. This is closest to the actual experience you get on PBE right now, and I personally love it.

I have a few counterpoints I want to bring up as a defense for this choice and why I support this VO:

1) The voice isn't FULLY unintelligible. In the case of the reverb and echo, Sona has had this built into her VO since day 1 really. Her normal VO has a ton of echo and reverb since it's supposed to be the mind-link she has with the summoner. Here's something I posted in another thread as a defense of what she "says:"

> ...it IS mashed up versions of her old quote system. For example, around 1:30, it sounds like she says "fanf-ends-a symph" which is really close to a recutting of "the fanfare ascends" and "a symphony of justice." At 1:37, it sounds like "uar-er-ime-uet" or "quarter time" and "a sublime duet." All of the quotes are like this, good job Riot!

Keep in mind these are the Kinetic VO portions. Concussive and Ethereal have their own banks with other quotes, and honestly the Concussive VO is so rad. I played back the video after the PBE patch today and I couldn't find the quotes that play in Concussive mode, though at this point it IS hard to pick out which is which, but that isn't a negative. I'll explain it in point 3.

2) It fits much better over the music than you think it does. Personally, I think the VO works best with Concussive right now. The echo and reverb make her one with the genre. The best way to experience it is to look at the SkinSpotlights video of the Concussive skill set. I personally don't think it breaks the flow of the skin at all. I personally think it adds to it. I'll probably make my own video to share with friends, I'm playing with the ingame sound mixer to get the best "DJ Sona" settings to prep for release. In the SkinSpotlights video, the music is too soft and the voices and SFX are too loud.

3) This is MAINLY a musical skin, and I personally see that reflected in the vocoding of the VO. If you've ever listened to "Different Trains" by Steve Reich (pulling out the BIG musical reference guns, lol), the entire purpose of that piece is to reflect the natural inflections of the voice. Inflections of the voice are pretty much the pitches you speak at, and this skin taps into this by vocoding them and using them conceptually as musical notes rather than actual words. This is how I noticed that the VO was remixed portions of the previous quote bank. Thus, they wanted her voice not to detract from the music, but to literally BE MUSIC itself. It's a fantastic concept!

"The voice isn't FULLY unintelligible"
I really don't think that two or three words here and there count.

"It fits much better over the music than you think it does"
I'm sorry I don't think you know what I think, friend.

"This is MAINLY a musical skin"
No, this is ENTIRELY a musical skin. Disk Jockeys aren't well known for their voices.


Yes you raise very good points. 

None of which I agree with. 

And herein lies the issue with this entire discussion, It's almost entirely subjective. At the end of the day there's going to be people who love the skin's "voice". There are going to be people who are willing to tolerate the vocal imperfections because how good the rest of the skin is. And then there are people who aren't going to purchase the skin exclusively because of how strongly the feel about the low quality of the voice. And honest to god it saddens me to the fucking core that the 3rd category even exists. Unfortunately, I'm in it. The following is not my quote but I think it sums up how I, and many, many, others feel right now about the current state of the skin.

"I'm legitimately debating whether or not the skin is actually worth the asking price. It'd be like finding the perfect car but later being told it only has 3 wheels; the dealer is the only person that can sell you the 4th but they won't no matter how much you ask. Do I want a 3-wheeled near perfect car? Or is my money better spent elsewhere on less perfect products that actually work?"

I really hope they continue to tune this and slightly adjust the Voice. I love Sona's harmonic voice, I love the idea that it has further developed effects per toggle. Hell, this has potential to be the coolest thing I have ever seen in League. But, to me, what it is in current form, sadly just feels wrong.

Its a really tough point for me because I want to enjoy league like I did in S3/4. I don't know what it is, but over the last few months it feels like so much is changing and I'm just getting left behind. I don't feel the drive and connection to league I once did. When I saw this Skin on top of Reddit this or yesterday morning, I was so excited. I love Sona and although the first weeks would be a rough flood of new Sona players, I was totally motivated to buy and play this. I'm still making my decision, but right now I'm fairly sure the Voice tilts me away from the Skin.

Here's hoping its tweaked...

This is only thing I don't like about that skin. I heard it from PBE and it just doesn't feel right. Either do normal VO or get rid of it completely.

One of the favourite things about Sona is her voice talking to you. Atm I feel like "What did she say?".

Honestly, I feel like the voice has been treated this way out of laziness or cheapness. They didn't hire a voice actress to record a new voice over, so they took the old one and remixed it and applied all these filters to disguise the fact that it's recycled. Ultimate skins are supposed to get a new VO. That's Riot's own rules listed in their skin tiers breakdown. Where's the new VO?

They actually did record new VO.
https://twitter.com/ErinFitzgerald/status/562689192153853954

Well shit. I don't like that any better though. They record new lines and you can't even tell how awesome they are because they're jumbled up and remixed with the old ones.

I don't like not being able to understand Sona. I guess that's subjective, but I think Riot's reason for making her unintelligible (to help her meld with the music) is weak. A voice is musical by nature; being rendered gibberish doesn't make it any more or less musical, but it does make it sound strange with the music turned off. Me? I always watch movies and TV with closed captioning on because I'm annoyed when I don't know what people are saying. Mumbling, not being able to understand what I'm hearing irks me. So I'm biased.

Even so, I still don't feel it satisfies the "a new voice over" element of the ultimate skin tier. They're still re-using a lot of the old VO and hiding it behind a remix. I just don't like that. It seems like cut corners when she has 3 hours of sound effects. I hope the voice gets some attention before she's released.

To each his own I guess. Between you and me I kinda like the VO. it feels like part of the music, and does feel fitting for the genre of music the skin has. Being unintelligible makes no real difference to me, outside of the fact that I might be a little sad if she doesn't have champion specific interactions.

Sona's voice does just that.  It says "stop what you're doing for a moment and process the nonsense I just attempted to think at you."

That's like saying listening to K-Pop or Italian singers is a 'problem' because you don't understand the language and listening to the music without understanding what someone is saying somehow detracts from the song. Sometimes it does but I still enjoy some good Ana Tijoux Spanish Rapping or my Italian screamo bands. I know what they're saying only because I looked up the meaning behind my favorite songs a while back, but listening to the song and getting lost in the emotions I don't feel I need to stop and try to understand it.

That's a *personal* preference. Some people don't have to understand the words to enjoy a musician's piece. I'd rather not understand what Sona is saying, I'd rather just listen to her ab lib her song incomprehensibly while the beat hypes me up
The problem is not actualy understanding what is she saying. I dont mind listening songs in other language. But this is something else. Its not language, its strange.

> I don't mean to be rude but have you played it yet?

Mate, what do you think?

>Just listening to the VO or watching videos really doesn't do it justice for some reason.

Maybe that's because it's a bad VO and it needs to be redone. I'm not about to down thirty dollary roos on the gamble that I might think that *it sounds better after I've paid for it.*
Simple fix. DONT buy the skin if you dont like it.
The simplest solution is almost never the best solution.

But, some people DO like the VO. You want to screw them because you are in the group of people that dont like it? what about the people who like it now, then they could end up unhappy. It is how it is, like it or leave it.
Do you even fucking know that** the voice is like dubstep with the actual music? **It's on PURPOSE.

Yeah? Now go ahead and actually read what I typed. *All of it.* I am very much aware it's done on purpose I even said so in my post. You'd know that if you read it all the first time. Just because it's done on purpose doesn't mean it doesn't break the flow of the music and detract from the overall quality of the skin.

> [{quoted}](name=Riposte,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=a7ExrdB9,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2015-02-05T10:15:30.791+0000)
>

That'd be a great argument if her base skin didn't already talk in my head.  The argument fell apart before you were able to type it out.

I'm not going to respond to all of you since you're basically saying the same thing.  "If you don't like it, don't buy it."  That's a terrible argument.  Are you honestly suggesting I just accept what Riot presents to me regardless of whether or not I have issues with it and just be happy with it?  At $30, the answer to that question will always be no.  Riot is the one that wants community feedback.  if they didn't, the pbe and these forums wouldn't exist at all.  Red posts wouldn't happen and the client/customer relationship they're trying to build further wouldn't exist.  I've given Riot my feedback and I've explained why her voice was subpar.  I'm sorry that I don't bend over and just accept what's given to me by a company seeking to make profit on a product.  It's my money and I would very much like to turn it over to Riot but one small detail is holding me back.  
For the fellow that told me to turn off the voice sounds, are you suggesting I play at a disadvantage then?  Voice sounds provide audio cues that let me know immediately that Diana threw out her Q, Lux is ulting, Shyvana jumped in somewhere, Rek'Sai is coming in, and Sion is on the war path.  Do you realize just how bad what you're suggesting is?
Maybe I should employ the strategy of boot-licking and perhaps I'd elicit a response from a Red over my legitimate concerns.  The only thing that I, and the others from here and elsewhere, are asking for is a Rioter to actually quell our concerns which, as of yet, they have not even attempted to do.  Or perhaps I should follow your advice and just willfully pass $30 to their bank accounts.  

What you all seem to be incapable of understanding is that I have chosen to spend my time seeking to help Riot make that product the best it could possibly be, similar to how you're spending your time trying to convince everyone it already is.  Both of us have similar goals and both of us want the same end game.  The only difference is I, and many others, miraculously arrived at a different opinion than you did.  Perish the thought.  To clarify, I want the skin and I can more than afford it but in it's current form, I have doubts it's actually worth the asking price.  Instead of stewing in my own disgust, I am opening up dialogues because I want to be convinced this is worth the price.

I just wanted to point out that even 30$ for a skin is a shitton of money. You can get fully priced games for this. 
Sure, there's alot of work put into it - and I'm willing to pay that much for a mere skin - as ultimate as it may be - but I'm having a hard time justifying it. I honestly don't know how much time goes into making a skin as say, making a game or anything like that... yet again, it's hard to put a pricetag on virtual goods. ... I'm not here to argue so, just wanted to say that.

To help put it into context a bit, your average music CD probably runs you to £10, so what, $12-15? for an album that's probably about an hour long.

The sound files for DJ Sona have been clocked at approximately 3 hours worth of effects/music etc. That's just the work that's gone into the SOUND. Then we have graphical effects, for the equivalent of 3x 1350-quality skins, which basically required a rebuild of Sona to include legs, fully animated DJ Decks, each of which being unique, as well as 3x unique AAs, 3x unique ultimates, 9x unique spell effects, and 9x unique passive effects for her AAs.

In short, lots of work. Lots and lots and lots of work. This was not a quick thing for them to knock out. And we haven't even talked about the EDM names they got on board to do it.
Can you sticky this? At least until the skin comes out?

I feel the need to leave this here.

If you feel like the VO ruins the skin, don't buy the skin. Not every aspect of every skin is going to please every player. That's impossible. I've had several skins come out that I was extremely disappointed in that I was looking forward to. Did Riot change the skin because some people didn't like it? Uh, no. Is Riot going to change her VO because half of the players dislike it? Well, if they change it because half of the players dislike it, **then the half that did will now be in those shoes**. Someone is not going to be pleased. Someone has to be. Lucky for me, I adore the skin and believe the VO fits perfectly with the music. Unfortunately, some of you don't. I understand and respect the arguments that have been made. I respect everyone's opinion because you're entitled to your opinion. All I'm saying is some of the people who have posted act like their opinion is the only one that matters and act like Riot is going to go bankrupt without their $30 for this skin.

This is how I think of it: These skins aren't just made for players. Yes, it's content for a game that you play and have the option to purchase, but all of these skins are more than just something you, the player, can buy, **they are art**. This skin is someone's baby. They've been working on it for a long time. (Obviously, more than one person.) Just like the champions are someone's babies that they've spent countless hours on. It belongs to those people in the artful sense. I relate this to tattoos. Yeah, you get that tattoo on your body, but did you do the work? No. That is the tattoo artist's work. That is their art. You display it on your body because you love what they've done (if your experience went as planned anyway). When I got my first tattoo, something that surprised me (and demanded my absolute respect) was when the tattoo artist was explaining how to care for it and what products not to use. She said, "Don't use Neosporin or insert-other-thing-here. Don't put that sh!t on my tattoos." She called the art on my body *hers*. I feel like that would anger anyone else, but I respected her immensely for it. It is hers. She's the artist, the creator. She takes pride in her work.

I'm sure everyone at Riot takes pride in their work just like that. They fix these champions and skins up, work on them until they adore them and are proud of what they've done. Then they announce it, put it up for testing, and adjust it to make their vision truly come alive and function properly in the game. **Their vision**. Not yours. Because it isn't your artwork.

Then they get all this hate because some people don't like it.

It's theirs. It accomplishes what they want it to accomplish and will function in the way that they want it to function. They can charge as much as they want for it, and they shouldn't be expected to listen to the whims of those who dislike it. Well, guess what, you don't have to buy what you don't like. You wouldn't hang an ugly picture on your living room wall. Don't buy a skin that you're not satisfied with. Many of us are entirely satisfied with this skin and appreciate it in the way Riot wanted.

Also, I find it disrespectful to call it bad quality and to call Riot lazy. The VO fits with Riot's vision. They are pleased with their work and are proud of their work. I'm not sure who was making this particular argument, or if something was misinterpreted, but I can try to address your points. :)

There is value in people doing tasks that we do not do ourselves. When I go to a restaurant, I pay someone to cook my food, and pay someone else to serve it to me, and I pay yet another person to clean up after me (not to mention paying the establishment for a place to eat.)  I'm not paying someone for things I cannot do, but rather what I'm not doing, if that makes sense. It's the foundation of civilization (we don't all have to farm so you can do something different for us.)

The price of the game has nothing to do with the price of the cosmetic goods they sell to go with it. For example, World of Warcraft has to be purchased, and a subscription is paid per month of use, and they also sell cosmetic virtual goods in a storefront in the form of mounts and miniature pets. The fact that their players pay $180 a year for the privilege to play their game that also has a box price is completely separate from their vanity pricing, just like skins in League of Legends has pricing completely separate from the fact that Riot has chosen to make their game free to obtain and play. 

The value of the vanity additions to the game are not easy to pinpoint, because it's a matter of personal taste and preference. I love Oriana, I do not like any skin she has more than her default skin. To me, any price paid for any of her skins is far too much. I can much more personal value in even a few dollars in a champion I rarely play. That's why instead of just describing the skins as virtual goods, some of us are calling them art. Like a painting, photograph, song, or tattoo, all of the skins in league will ultimately be loved, hated, and ignored all at once by different portions of the community. 

And usually for someone to post on the boards they have strong opinions of the topic they're discussing, or have a strong desire to white-knight or mediate. That's fine, this should be a place to explore differences of opinion. Miscommunication can and will happen, especially when opinions are stated with passion and emotion. But for any discussion to be fruitful it must be directed at the problem, and the finger-pointing that crops up quickly eclipses strong and valid points that  participants have.
